description: From a West African language; compare Akan apɔsɔ.

entries.meaning: A small primate, Perodicticus potto, native to the tropical rainforests of Africa. [from 18th c.]
examples: The forest hangs round them like a theater curtain, mist rising from the water, half-drowned things – jackals, monkeys, pottos, bushpigs – wading along with them, looking dazed and bearish.
